title: The Old Pond
poem:
An old silent pond
A frog jumps into the pond—
Splash! Silence again.
author: Matsuo Basho

title: The Man from Peru
poem:
There once was a man from Peru
Who dreamed he was eating his shoe.
author: Anonymous

title: Office Escape
poem:
Distant laughter fades,
Work piles high on the desk now—
A moment, just mine.
author: Anonymous

title: Morning Bloom
poem:
A lonely flower
Blooms in the still morning air—
All my thoughts of you
author: Anonymous

title: Sonnet 18
poem:
Shall I compare thee to a summer's day?
Thou art more lovely and more temperate:
author: William Shakespeare
